p.s: The sonnet Sonnet 65 vby William ShakespearShakespeare is about the spoil of beauty in nature through humanity.
It is divided in three quatrains and a final couplet.
It shows an iambic pentametrepentameter and every quatrain holds a cross-rhyme.
The final couplet rhymes as a pair.
The first quatrain is about the human destruction of nature.
It shows that humans do not give nature a chance to hold on to it'sits beauty.
So ShakespearShakespeare asks the question of who is not capable of harming a flower.

Further in the second quatrain ShakespearShakespeare extends his question and asks how summer's honey should protect itself from human when even rocks and steel are not as strong to protect themselfsthemselves.
In the last quatrain ShakespearShakespeare tries to find a soulutionsolution for that decay of beauty in nature, caused by humanity.
The final couplet discovers that nothing can solve it but poetry and sonnets.
So he has to describe it as good as possible to get nature to survive in his writings.
